Once the sketch is complete, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Then, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Next, extrude the sketch along the normal vector by a distance of 0.0938 units and in the opposite direction of the normal vector by a distance of 0 units. The sketch scale for this extrusion should be 0.75. This completes the construction of part 1. The length of this part is 0.75 units, the width is 0.0938 units, and the height is 0.75 units. The final shape of this part is a 3D model of a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section.</description>

Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1339, 0.375, 0.375] Sketch Create two sketches on different planes of the coordinate system: Sketch 1 (Face 1) - Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0268, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.0268, 0.0], End Point [0.0268, 0.2679] - Line 3: Start Point [0.0268, 0.2679], End Point [0.0, 0.2679] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.2679], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Sketch 2 (Face 2) - Loop 1 - Line 1: Start Point [0.4554, 0.0], End Point [0.4821, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.4821, 0.0], End Point [0.4821, 0.2679] - Line 3: Start Point [0.4821, 0.2679], End Point [0.4554, 0.2679] - Line 4: Start Point [0.4554, 0.2679], End Point [0.4554, 0.0] Extrusion Extrude both sketches along the Z-axis separately: - Sketch 1 Extrusion - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.375 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.4821 - Sketch 2 Extrusion - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.375 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.4821 Join the resulting two solids using the "JoinFeatureOperation" operation.</description>
